TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FileStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: 为文件提供 ，既支持同步读写操作，也支持异步读写操作。

span.span: Provides a for a file, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous read and write operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用类来读取、 写入来，打开和关闭文件在文件系统中，并操纵其他与文件相关的操作系统句柄，包括管道、 标准输入和标准输出。Use the class to read from, write to, open, and close files on a file system, and to manipulate other file-related operating system handles, including pipes, standard input, and standard output. 你可以使用， ， ，和方法执行同步操作时，或， ， ，和执行异步方法操作。You can use the , , , and methods to perform synchronous operations, or the , , , and methods to perform asynchronous operations. 使用异步方法而不会阻止主线程中执行资源密集型文件操作。Use the asynchronous methods to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 缓冲输入和输出以提高性能。 buffers input and output for better performance. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用实现 IDisposable 的对象"部分接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 属性检测是否异步打开的文件句柄。The property detects whether the file handle was opened asynchronously. 在创建的实例时指定此值类使用的构造函数`isAsync`， `useAsync`，或`options`参数。You specify this value when you create an instance of the class using a constructor that has an `isAsync`, `useAsync`, or `options` parameter. 当该属性是`true`，流利用重叠的 I/O，异步执行文件操作。When the property is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 但是，属性不具有要`true`调用， ，或方法。However, the property does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 当属性是`false`和调用异步读取和写入操作，仍未被阻止 UI 线程、，但同步执行实际的 I/O 操作。When the property is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. 方法支持随机访问文件。The method supports random access to files. 允许读/写位置移动到文件中的任意位置。 allows the read/write position to be moved to any position within the file. 这是使用字节偏移量的引用点参数进行的。This is done with byte offset reference point parameters. 字节偏移量是相对于查找引用点，可以是开头、 当前的位置或基础的文件中，末尾的三个成员由表示枚举。The byte offset is relative to the seek reference point, which can be the beginning, the current position, or the end of the underlying file, as represented by the three members of the enumeration. > [!NOTE] > 磁盘文件始终支持随机访问。Disk files always support random access. 构造，次属性值设置为`true`或`false`具体取决于基础的文件类型。如果基础的文件类型 FILE_TYPE_DISK 中 winbase.h，, 定义属性值是`true`。At the time of construction, the property value is set to `true` or `false` depending on the underlying file type.If the underlying file type is FILE_TYPE_DISK, as defined in winbase.h, the property value is `true`. 否则为属性值是`false`。Otherwise, the property value is `false`. 如果进程终止，并显示锁定文件的一部分或关闭具有未完成的锁的文件，该行为不确定。If a process terminates with part of a file locked or closes a file that has outstanding locks, the behavior is undefined. 目录操作和其他文件操作，请参阅， ，和类。For directory operations and other file operations, see the , , and classes. 类是一个实用工具类具有静态方法主要用于创建对象，基于文件路径。The class is a utility class that has static methods primarily for the creation of objects based on file paths. 类从字节数组创建一个流，它类似于类。The class creates a stream from a byte array and is similar to the class. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## 检测到的流位置更改Detection of Stream Position Changes 当对象不具有独占持有其句柄，另一个线程无法同时访问的文件句柄并且无法更改与文件句柄关联的操作系统的文件指针的位置。When a object does not have an exclusive hold on its handle, another thread could access the file handle concurrently and change the position of the operating system's file pointer that is associated with the file handle. 在此情况下中的缓存位置可能危及对象和缓冲区中的缓存的数据。In this case, the cached position in the object and the cached data in the buffer could be compromised. 对象定期执行的方法的访问缓存的缓冲区，以确保操作系统的句柄位置使用的缓存位置相同的检查对象。The object routinely performs checks on methods that access the cached buffer to ensure that the operating system's handle position is the same as the cached position used by the object. 如果在句柄位置中的发生意外的更改对的调用中检测到方法，.NET Framework 放弃缓冲区的内容，并再次从文件读取流。If an unexpected change in the handle position is detected in a call to the method, the .NET Framework discards the contents of the buffer and reads the stream from the file again. 这可能会影响性能，具体取决于文件和可能影响的文件流的位置的任何其他进程的大小。This can affect performance, depending on the size of the file and any other processes that could affect the position of the file stream. 如果在句柄位置中的发生意外的更改对的调用中检测到方法，缓冲区的内容将被丢弃和引发异常。If an unexpected change in the handle position is detected in a call to the method, the contents of the buffer are discarded and an exception is thrown. A对象将不具有独占持有其句柄时任一访问属性时要公开句柄或对象都提供了其构造函数中的属性。A object will not have an exclusive hold on its handle when either the property is accessed to expose the handle or the object is given the property in its constructor. ## Examples 下面的示例演示的一些构造函数。The following example demonstrates some of the constructors. [!code-cpp[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/CPP/fstream class.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/CS/fstream class.cs#1)] [!code-vb[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/VB/fstream class.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示如何以异步方式写入到的文件。The following example shows how to write to a file asynchronously. 此代码具有名为 UserInput 和挂钩到名为 Button_Click 一个 Click 事件处理程序按钮 TextBlock 的 WPF 应用中运行。This code runs in a WPF app that has a TextBlock named UserInput and a button hooked up to a Click event handler that is named Button_Click. 需要更改为不是在计算机上存在的文件的文件路径。The file path needs to be changed to a file than exits on the computer. [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当是调用，还关闭此句柄和文件的句柄计数会递减。When is called, the handle is also closed and the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream` 假定它具有对该句柄的独有控制。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 读取、 写入或查找时`FileStream`也持有句柄可能会导致数据损坏。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 为了数据安全，调用之前使用该句柄，并避免之外调用任何方法`Close`完成后使用此句柄。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支持直接访问通过是设备名称，如的路径的物理磁盘"\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`参数可以为文件名，包括通用命名约定 (UNC) 共享上的文件。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. 构造函数被授予读/写访问权限，对该文件，并且打开共享读访问权限 (即，请求打开文件进行写入的这个或另一个进程之前，无法`FileStream`对象已关闭，但读取尝试将成功)。The constructor is given read/write access to the file, and it is opened sharing Read access (that is, requests to open the file for writing by this or another process will fail until the `FileStream` object has been closed, but read attempts will succeed). 不能使用此构造函数可用来打开只读文件;相反，你必须使用接受一个构造函数`FileAccess`参数值设置为`FileAccess.Read`。You cannot use this constructor to open read-only files; instead, you must use a constructor that accepts a `FileAccess` parameter with the value set to `FileAccess.Read`. 缓冲区大小设置为 4096 个字节 (4 KB) 的默认大小。The buffer size is set to the default size of 4096 bytes (4 KB). > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是存储在磁盘; 上的文件它可以是系统的支持通过流访问的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，具体取决于系统中，此类可以访问物理设备。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 是`true`所有封装文件的对象。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`指示不支持查找，设备所产生的属性是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. 构造函数，而无需参数，如果`mode`参数设置为，是默认访问权限。For constructors without a parameter, if the `mode` parameter is set to , is the default access. 否则，将访问权限设置为。Otherwise, the access is set to . > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将数据写入到文件，逐字节，然后验证数据是否被正确写入。The following code example shows how to write data to a file, byte by byte, and then verify that the data was written correctly. remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream` 假定它具有对该句柄的独有控制。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 读取、 写入或查找时`FileStream`也持有句柄可能会导致数据损坏。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 为了数据安全，调用之前使用该句柄，并避免之外调用任何方法`Close`完成后使用此句柄。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，对读取和写入句柄之前调用此`FileStream`构造函数。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 使用指定的读/写权限和 实例所属权为指定的文件句柄初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified file handle, with the specified read/write permission and instance ownership.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream`对象为文件指定指定的访问权限。The `FileStream` object is given the specified access to the file. 句柄的所有权将按指定方式。The ownership of the handle will be as specified. 如果此进程拥有句柄调用方法也将关闭句柄和文件的句柄计数会递减。If this process owns the handle, a call to the method will also close the handle and the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream`对象都提供了默认缓冲区大小 （4096 字节）。The `FileStream` object is given the default buffer size of 4096 bytes. `FileStream` 假定它具有对该句柄的独有控制。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 读取、 写入或查找时`FileStream`也持有句柄可能会导致数据损坏。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 为了数据安全，调用之前使用该句柄，并避免调用的方法以外`Close`完成后使用此句柄。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 使用指定的路径、创建模式和读/写权限初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified path, creation mode, and read/write permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支持直接访问通过是设备名称，如的路径的物理磁盘"\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`参数可以为文件名，包括通用命名约定 (UNC) 共享上的文件。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. 构造函数被授予读/写访问权限，对该文件，并且打开共享读访问权限 (即，请求打开文件进行写入的这个或另一个进程之前，无法`FileStream`对象已关闭，但读取尝试将成功)。The constructor is given read/write access to the file, and it is opened sharing Read access (that is, requests to open the file for writing by this or another process will fail until the `FileStream` object has been closed, but read attempts will succeed). 缓冲区大小设置为 4096 个字节 (4 KB) 的默认大小。The buffer size is set to the default size of 4096 bytes (4 KB). > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是存储在磁盘; 上的文件它可以是系统的支持通过流访问的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，具体取决于系统中，此类可以访问物理设备。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 是`true`所有封装文件的对象。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`指示不支持查找，设备所产生的属性是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 使用指定的读/写权限、缓冲区大小和同步或异步状态为指定的文件句柄初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified file handle, with the specified read/write permission, buffer size, and synchronous or asynchronous state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你设置`isAsync`参数`true`以异步方式打开的文件句柄。You set the `isAsync` parameter to `true` to open the file handle asynchronously. 当该参数是`true`，流利用重叠的 I/O，异步执行文件操作。When the parameter is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 但是，该参数不一定要`true`调用， ，或方法。However, the parameter does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 当`isAsync`参数是`false`和调用异步读取和写入操作，仍未被阻止 UI 线程、，但同步执行实际的 I/O 操作。When the `isAsync` parameter is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. `FileStream` 假定它具有对该句柄的独有控制。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 读取、 写入或查找时`FileStream`也持有句柄可能会导致数据损坏。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 为了数据安全，调用之前使用该句柄，并避免之外调用任何方法`Close`完成后使用此句柄。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，对读取和写入句柄之前调用此`FileStream`构造函数。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 使用指定的读/写权限、 实例所属权、缓冲区大小和同步或异步状态为指定的文件句柄初始化 类的新实例。

remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream`对象为文件指定指定的访问权限。The `FileStream` object is given the specified access to the file. 句柄的所有权将按指定方式。The ownership of the handle will be as specified. 如果此`FileStream`拥有句柄，调用方法也将关闭句柄。If this `FileStream` owns the handle, a call to the method will also close the handle. 具体而言，该文件的句柄计数会递减。In particular, the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream`对象都提供了指定的缓冲区大小。The `FileStream` object is given the specified buffer size. `FileStream` 假定它具有对该句柄的独有控制。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 读取、 写入或查找时`FileStream`也持有句柄可能会导致数据损坏。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 为了数据安全，调用之前使用该句柄，并避免之外调用任何方法`Close`完成后使用此句柄。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，对读取和写入句柄之前调用此`FileStream`构造函数。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 默认值为那些构造函数，而无需`FileShare`参数。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支持直接访问通过是设备名称，如的路径的物理磁盘"\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `fileOptions`参数用于提供对在创建时可以利用的更高级操作访问对象。The `fileOptions` parameter is used to provide access to more advanced operations that can be leveraged when creating a object. `path`参数可以为文件名，包括通用命名约定 (UNC) 共享上的文件。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是存储在磁盘; 上的文件它可以是系统的支持通过流访问的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，具体取决于系统中，此类可以访问物理设备。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 是`true`所有封装文件的对象。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`指示不支持查找，设备所产生的属性是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . > [!CAUTION] > 当你使用特定的区域性设置进行编译的一组字符，并检索这些具有不同的区域性设置的相同字符时，字符可能无法解释，并可能会导致引发异常。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例将数据写入文件，然后读取数据使用对象。The following example writes data to a file and then reads the data using the object. [!code-cpp[IO.FileStream.ctor1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor1/cpp/example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IO.FileStream.ctor1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor1/CS/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IO.FileStream.ctor1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor1/VB/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在.NET Framework 4 和更早版本中，你必须使用方法，如和来实现异步文件操作。In the .NET Framework 4 and earlier versions, you have to use methods such as and to implement asynchronous file operations. 这些方法是在中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支持旧版代码; 但是，新的异步方法，如， ， ，和，帮助你更轻松地实现异步文件操作。These methods are still available in the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] to support legacy code; however, the new async methods, such as , , , and , help you implement asynchronous file operations more easily. 必须为对每个调用一次调用。 must be called exactly once for every call to . 如果在开始另一个读取之前，结束读取的进程可能会导致意外行为，如死锁。Failing to end a read process before beginning another read can cause undesirable behavior such as deadlock. 提供两个不同的操作模式： I/O 同步和异步 I/O。 provides two different modes of operation: synchronous I/O and asynchronous I/O. 尽管可以使用任一，基础的操作系统资源可能允许访问，只有其中一种模式中。While either can be used, the underlying operating system resources might allow access in only one of these modes. 默认情况下，同步打开的操作系统句柄。By default, opens the operating system handle synchronously. 在 Windows 中，这将降低异步方法。In Windows, this slows down asynchronous methods. 如果使用异步方法，使用构造函数。If asynchronous methods are used, use the constructor. > [!NOTE] > 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . 如果流已关闭或传递了无效参数，将立即引发异常从。If a stream is closed or you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately from . 异步读取请求，例如 IO 请求过程的磁盘故障过程中发生的错误发生在线程池线程和调用时变得可见。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request, such as a disk failure during the IO request, occur on the thread pool thread and become visible upon a call to . 必须与此调用若要了解读取的多少字节数。 must be called with this to find out how many bytes were read. 多个同时进行的异步请求呈现请求完成顺序不确定。Multiple simultaneous asynchronous requests render the request completion order uncertain. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供构造函数。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the constructor. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重写 。This method overrides . 当调用方法，操作系统 I/O 缓冲区，也会刷新。When you call the method, the operating system I/O buffer is also flushed. 除非你明确地调用不会刷新流的编码器或释放对象。A stream’s encoder is not flushed unless you explicitly call or dispose of the object. 设置到`true`意味着数据从缓冲区刷新到流中，但不是会刷新编码器状态。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 这将允许编码器，以便它可以正确编码的字符的下一步块保持其状态 （部分字符）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 这种情况下会影响 UTF8 和 UTF7 其中某些字符仅后才能进行编码的编码器收到的相邻字符。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. 因为缓冲区可以用于读取或写入，执行以下两个功能：Because a buffer can be used for either reading or writing, performs the following two functions: - 以前向缓冲区写入任何数据复制到文件和其编码器状态除外清除缓冲区。Any data previously written to the buffer is copied to the file and the buffer is cleared except for its encoder state. - 如果是`true`和以前将数据从文件复制到缓冲区以进行读取，该文件中的当前位置将减少的缓冲区中的未读字节数。If is `true` and data was previously copied from the file to the buffer for reading, the current position within the file is decremented by the number of unread bytes in the buffer. 然后清除缓冲区。The buffer is then cleared. 使用方法重载时你想要确保中间文件缓冲区中的所有缓冲数据写入到磁盘。Use the method overload when you want to ensure that all buffered data in intermediate file buffers is written to disk. ## Examples 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供方法。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the method. ACL 描述个人和/或组具有或没有执行到给定的文件上的特定操作的权限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性是与操作系统的系统提供的系统调用一起使用的操作系统句柄 (如`ReadFile`Windows 上)。This property is an operating system handle for use with operating-system-provided system calls (such as `ReadFile` on Windows). 它不会使用 C 库函数，如预期的文件描述符， `fread`。It will not work with C library functions that expect a file descriptor, such as `fread`. 操作系统句柄可能打开过同步或异步，具体取决于`FileStream`已调用构造函数。The operating system handle might have been opened synchronously or asynchronously, depending on which `FileStream` constructor was called. 使用属性来发现是否以异步方式打开此句柄。Use the property to discover whether this handle was opened asynchronously. 在 Win32 中，这意味着句柄已打开为重叠的 IO，并且它要求在不同的参数到`ReadFile`和`WriteFile`。In Win32, this means the handle was opened for overlapped IO, and it requires different parameters to `ReadFile` and `WriteFile`. > [!CAUTION] > 如果可能发生数据损坏`FileStream`是创建，其句柄传递、 某些操作移动句柄的文件指针，然后`FileStream`会再次使用。Data corruption might occur if a `FileStream` is created, its handle is passed, some operation moves the handle's file pointer, and then the `FileStream` is used again. 多个线程不能同时安全地写入到相同文件，和`FileStream`缓冲代码假定它以独占方式控制该句柄。Multiple threads cannot safely write to the same file simultaneously, and `FileStream` buffering code assumes that it exclusively controls the handle. `FileStream` 可能引发如果`FileStream`检测到某些其他进程已移动的文件指针。`FileStream` might throw an if `FileStream` detects that some other process has moved the file pointer. 若要避免此问题，不写入任何数据到文件的一部分，`FileStream`可能具有缓冲，并将文件指针还原到在上一次调用方法时的位置`FileStream`。To avoid this, do not write any data into a portion of the file that `FileStream` might have buffered, and restore the file pointer to the location it had when methods were last called on `FileStream`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `IsAsync`属性检测是否`FileStream`句柄已异步打开的使代码能够使用属性正确。The `IsAsync` property detects whether the `FileStream` handle was opened asynchronously, enabling your code to use the property correctly. 在 Win32 中，`IsAsync`正在 true 表示句柄为重叠 I/O 打开并因而需要不同的参数到`ReadFile`和`WriteFile`。In Win32, `IsAsync` being true means the handle was opened for overlapped I/O, and thus requires different parameters to `ReadFile` and `WriteFile`. 在创建的实例时指定此值类使用的构造函数`isAsync`， `useAsync`，或`options`参数。You specify this value when you create an instance of the class using a constructor that has an `isAsync`, `useAsync`, or `options` parameter. 当该属性是`true`，流利用重叠的 I/O，异步执行文件操作。When the property is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 但是，属性不具有要`true`调用， ，或方法。However, the property does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 当属性是`false`和调用异步读取和写入操作，仍未被阻止 UI 线程、，但同步执行实际的 I/O 操作。When the property is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. ## Examples 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供构造函数。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the constructor. remarks.format: ## Remarks 支持查找到流的长度超出任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is supported. 当您寻求超出长度的文件时，文件大小就会增加。When you seek beyond the length of the file, the file size grows. 在 Microsoft Windows NT 和更高，则将添加到文件末尾的任何数据设置为零。In Microsoft Windows NT and newer, any data added to the end of the file is set to zero. 在 Microsoft Windows 98 或更早版本，添加到文件末尾的任何数据未设置为零，这意味着，先前删除的数据是可见写入流。In Microsoft Windows 98 or earlier, any data added to the end of the file is not set to zero, which means that previously deleted data is visible to the stream. 将流的当前位置设置为较大的值超出在 Windows 98 或更早版本的流的末尾，则可能会导致正在引发的异常。Setting the position of the stream to a large value beyond the end of the stream in Windows 98 or earlier may result in an exception being raised. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用`Length`和`Position`属性，以检查文件尾条件。The following example uses the `Length` and `Position` properties to check for an end-of-file condition. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重写 。This method overrides . `offset`参数指定了中的字节的偏移量`array`（缓冲区索引） 在此处开始读取，和`count`参数指定了最大要从此流中读取的字节数。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in `array` (the buffer index) at which to begin reading, and the `count` parameter gives the maximum number of bytes to be read from this stream. 如果已到达流结尾，则返回的值是实际数字节，则为零。The returned value is the actual number of bytes read, or zero if the end of the stream is reached. 如果读取的操作成功，是通过读取的字节数高级流的当前位置。If the read operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read. 如果发生异常，则流的当前位置不变。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. 方法返回仅在到达流的末尾后的零。The method returns zero only after reaching the end of the stream. 否则为始终至少 1 个字节从流中读取在返回之前。Otherwise, always reads at least one byte from the stream before returning. 如果不会提供数据时调用流中，该方法将一直阻止到至少一个字节的数据可以返回。If no data is available from the stream upon a call to , the method will block until at least one byte of data can be returned. 实现可以自由地返回少于所请求的字节，即使尚未达到流结尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. 使用读取基元数据类型。Use for reading primitive data types. 不会中断正在执行读取的操作的线程。Do not interrupt a thread that is performing a read operation. 尽管应用程序可能看起来后取消阻止该线程尚未成功运行，但中断会降低应用程序的性能和可靠性。Although the application may appear to run successfully after the thread is unblocked, the interruption can decrease your application's performance and reliability. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例读取从内容并将其写入到另一个。The following example reads the contents from a and writes it into another . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的文件操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果在完成之前，将取消该操作，返回的任务包含值属性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 如果文件句柄将被释放，则返回的任务包含中的异常属性。If the handle to the file is disposed, the returned task contains the exception in the property. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何以异步方式从文件读取。The following example shows how to read from a file asynchronously. span.para: 上的默认实现创建一个新的单字节数组，然后调用。虽然这是正式正确的效率低。所有具有内部缓冲区的流应重写此方法，并提供一个要高效得多的读取缓冲区直接，避免额外的数组分配每次调用的版本。通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。

The default implementation on creates a new single-byte array and then calls . While this is formally correct, it is inefficient. Any stream with an internal buffer should override this method and provide a much more efficient version that reads the buffer directly, avoiding the extra array allocation on every call. For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重写 。This method overrides . `offset`参数指定了中的字节的偏移量`array`（缓冲区索引） 从此处开始复制，和`count`参数指定了将写入到流的字节数。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in `array` (the buffer index) at which to begin copying, and the `count` parameter gives the number of bytes that will be written to the stream. 如果写入操作成功，流的当前位置被高级通过写入的字节数。If the write operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes written. 如果发生异常，则流的当前位置不变。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. > [!NOTE] > 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . 不会中断正在执行的写入操作的线程。Do not interrupt a thread that is performing a write operation. 尽管应用程序可能看起来后取消阻止该线程尚未成功运行，但中断会降低应用程序的性能和可靠性。Although the application may appear to run successfully after the thread is unblocked, the interruption can decrease your application's performance and reliability. 通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供方法。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的文件操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果在完成之前，将取消该操作，返回的任务包含值属性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 如果文件句柄将被释放，则返回的任务包含中的异常属性。If the handle to the file is disposed, the returned task contains the exception in the property. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何以异步方式写入到的文件。The following example shows how to write asynchronously to a file. [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重写 。This method overrides . 使用`WriteByte`写入到一个字节`FileStream`有效。Use `WriteByte` to write a byte to a `FileStream` efficiently. 如果流已关闭，或者不可写，则将引发异常。If the stream is closed or not writable, an exception will be thrown. > [!NOTE] > 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 有关附加信息，请参见 。For additional information, see . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将数据写入到文件，逐字节，然后验证数据是否被正确写入。The following code example shows how to write data to a file, byte by byte, and then verify that the data was written correctly. [!code-cpp[System.IO.FileStream1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream1/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.FileStream1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream1/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.FileStream1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream1/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: The stream is closed.

exception.span: 流不支持写入。

span.span: The stream does not support writing.

span.para: 上的默认实现创建一个新的单字节数组，然后调用。虽然这是正式正确的效率低。所有具有内部缓冲区的流应重写此方法，并提供一个要高效得多的读取缓冲区直接，避免额外的数组分配每次调用的版本。通用文件和目录操作的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。

The default implementation on creates a new single-byte array and then calls . While this is formally correct, it is inefficient. Any stream with an internal buffer should override this method and provide a much more efficient version that reads the buffer directly, avoiding the extra array allocation on every call. For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).
